predicate.note: Frames file for 'culminate' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to reach the highest point, to end

example.name: intransitive
example.text: In the six trading days since the UAL labor-management buy-out group failed [*-1] to get bank financing , [*] culminating Friday with the withdrawal of its partner British Airways PLC , UAL stock has plummeted by 41 % to 168 1\/2 from 285 1\/4 .
example.arg: with the withdrawal of its partner British Airways PLC

example.name: culminate in
example.text: A licensed government intellectual , Francis Fukuyama , recently announced in The National Interest that history is , so [*] to speak [*T*-1] , at an end since the course of human progress has now culminated in the glorious full stop of American civilization .
example.arg: the glorious full stop of American civilization

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mr. Honecker 's ignoble fall culminates nearly two decades of iron-handed leadership during which Mr. Honecker , now 77 years old , built East Germany into the most economically advanced nation in the Soviet bloc [*T*-1] .
example.arg: nearly two decades of iron-handed leadership during which Mr. Honecker , now 77 years old , built East Germany into the most economically advanced nation in the Soviet bloc [*T*-1]
